E. Jane McShane is Britain's Under-14 Chess Champion. She loves playing chess and is very successful at it.
F. Jane's mother said, "By the end of that afternoon she had memorised all the moves, and by 6 was starting to beat adults."

Chris Greener was tall when he was fourteen, and he is still the tallest man in Britain today. Every year, more and more people are born who are tall. This does not mean that humanity is producing a new super race. We are returning to what we were like as cavemen. Our ancestors ate a wide variety of foods, including fruits, berries, and herbs. But when agriculture was invented, our diet changed. We started to eat mostly wheat, rice, and maize. This poor diet has had a disastrous effect on human health and physique.
However, there is a positive trend. In Europe, the US, and Japan, people are now eating diets that are more like our ancestors' diets. As a result, the average man in these countries is now taller than he was in the past. But there are still some problems. For example, the bed-length and leg-room in planes and trains have not increased, and clothes manufacturers are constantly having to revise their range of products. The question is: where will it all end? We cannot grow forever. We must have some programmed upper limit. But what is it? Scientists say it could be as much as 193 cm.

Studio audiences are a common feature of television life. They are made up of people from all classes, professions and income groups. People often go to studio audiences to appear on television, take a look behind the scenes, or simply have fun.
When you sit in a studio audience, you are squashed among strangers and someone flashes cards with APPLAUD or LAUGH on them. You clap or laugh accordingly. This may reflect the reality of some television, but not all by any means.
Going to a studio may be a terrible way to watch television, but that's not what's important. For most of the audience, it was simply fun and a free night of entertainment.

Bruce likes landscapes that have a human element. He finds it important to have people in the landscape. When he travels abroad, he likes to visit lovely villages with old temples. He also likes exploring the countryside.
Sophia loves a miniature railway that goes from Hythe to Dungeness. The scenery is not spectacular, but she enjoys seeing people in their back gardens.
Matthew likes the Hartland Peninsula. It is a remote and lovely coast. The beaches are hard to reach and scattered with rocks.
Annette's favourite place in England is the Trough of Bowland. It is a landscape of wide-open moorland which is perfect for hiking.
James purchased Glenthorne, his favourite house in Britain. It is a secluded and romantic house.

We love animals. One day, my daughter found a pine snake. We decided to keep it overnight. I set up a special tank for the snake. It was a long day. There was a lot of confusion. The snake escaped. I was scared. I tried to catch the snake, but I tripped and fell on the floor. The snake was still there. I crouched like a rabbit and waited for the snake to move. But the snake didn't move. I eventually managed to catch the snake and release it back into the wild.

In our busy world, people use phones, fax machines and computers to communicate. But there is something special about receiving a letter that cannot be matched by any other form of communication. It's the excitement of its arrival, the pleasure of seeing who it is from and the enjoyment of the contents.
I have been writing letters for as long as I can remember. I started writing to my mother when I was young. My mother also taught me to write thank-you letters for Christmas and birthday presents. When I left home to train as a doctor, I wrote letters to my parents and friends. I also had penfriends from all over the world.
I love receiving letters. They make me feel happy and connected to people. They also help me to improve my writing skills. I am pleased that my children are carrying on the tradition of letter writing. I encourage everyone to write letters to their friends and family.

Tens of thousands of ancient pictures carved into the rocks at Mont Bego in the French Alps are being damaged. The drawings include pictures of cows with horns, cultivated fields and various gods and goddesses. But as the popularity of the site increases, the pictures are being ruined by thoughtless graffiti.
The mountain is scattered with 4,000-year-old drawings cut into bare rock. People are damaging the drawings by stamping on them, wearing away the rock and definition of the artwork as they do so. Some visitors even chop off parts of the drawings to take home as souvenirs.
Experts are divided over the best way to preserve the drawings. Some believe that the only way to save the site is to turn the whole mountain into a 'no-go' area, preventing the public from going there except on guided tours. Others believe that the best solution is to let people look at the site, but to charge a fee or rope off the area and provide guides.

Young shoppers often go to the supermarket with their parents. Sometimes, they want everything they see. If it's not the latest cereal, it's a Disney video or a comic. Usually, all three. Parents sometimes have a hard time deciding what to buy. They feel guilty if they say no to their children's demands. And they feel bad if they give in to their children's demands. Sometimes, parents are inconsistent and hypocritical in their responses to their children's purchasing requests. Supermarkets could do a lot more to ease parent-child conflict.

Once upon a time, climbers went to the mountains. Now, you can climb anywhere, indoors or out. The crowd holds its breath. High above them on the climbing wall, hanging upside down by the tips of two fingers, is the French climber Francois Lombard. He is competing in the World Cup Climbing Championships at Birmingham's National Indoor Arena. The National Indoor Arena is famous for staging the TV show Gladiators, but it also hosts the World Cup Climbing Championships. The fact that either event is possible is the result of a new and rapidly developing technology. Until the mid-1960s, climbers practised their skills on cliffs. During the winter, they would either tolerate the cold weather or go walking instead of climbing. As the sport developed, it was increasingly important for top climbers to keep fit. They used brick-edges or stone buildings to 'work out' on. Many sports centres started building walls specifically for climbing. These walls had special edges that made it easier for climbers to hold on. However, there were some problems with these walls. They could only be built in a vertical plane, and they were not very comfortable to climb. In 1985, a Frenchman named Francois Savigny developed a new material that made it easier for climbers to hold on. This material could be fixed onto any existing wall and then taken off when climbers got bored with a particular combination.

If you want to become an actor, it's a risky career. There are a lot of actors, but not enough jobs. If you choose to become an actor, people will probably tell you that you're crazy. But it's a personal choice and only you can decide if you want to do it. There are no easy ways to become an actor. You need to be lucky and talented. But there is also the possibility of excitement, glamour and the occasional rich reward.
If you ask actors how they have done well, they will not know. They will know certain things about themselves and aspects of their own technique and the techniques of others. But they will take nothing for granted, because they know that they are only as good as their current job. And, if you don't care enough, no-one else will care about you.

We have a selection of cookbooks that are perfect for all levels of cooks.
There is a book by Delia Smith that is very popular. It has a lot of easy-to-follow recipes and it's a great reference book for cooks of all levels.
Another popular cookbook is by Raymond Blanc. It has a lot of amazing recipes and it's a very practical book.
If you're interested in traditional French cooking, Le Cordon Bleu is the book for you. It has a lot of classic recipes and it's a great book for beginners.
Finally, if you're looking for quick and easy recipes, Nigel Slater's book, The 30-Minute Cook, is perfect for you. It has a lot of delicious recipes that can be made in 30 minutes or less.

The Farmer Matt Froggatt used to be an insurance agent but now runs a sheep farm. He was made redundant and decided to set up the farm. He supplies meat through mail order and is glad he's no longer stuck in the office.
The Painter Ron Able white was a manager in advertising but now makes a living as an artist. He decided to take redundancy and become an artist. He was helped by a career counsellor and has been lucky in that his friendships have survived the distance.
The Haymaker Katherine Goodison set up her own business in her London flat, making hats for private clients. She left her job as a lawyer because she wanted to have a better work-life balance and was happier in her new job.
The Masseur Paul Drinkwater worked in finance for 16 years before becoming a masseur. He was unhappy with his job and decided to change careers. He got qualifications in massage and is now happy and in control of his destiny.

Two brothers, Dave and Norm Lagasse, live in Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA. They have a childhood game that is very popular. It's called pichenotte. The game is like a wheel-like board with 12 pieces called pucks. You can flick the pucks across the board using your hand. If you flick a puck into a hole, you get 20 points. The game usually lasts just two minutes.
The Lagasses started making their own boards and selling them to people. They made so much money that they decided to go into the pichenotte business full-time. They set up a workshop in their garage and started turning out boards. More than 450 boards have been produced to date.
The game is popular and people are making money from it. But there are no professional pichenotte players or TV coverage yet. Nonetheless, the day is not far off when the Lagasses' garage will be home to a luxury Mercedes rather than a saw and piles of wood.

Welcome to the Model Village. It was once a waste ground, flat and overgrown with brambles. But thanks to the careful planning and hard work of one man, supported by his wife, the land was transformed into the beautiful village you see today. Many tons of soil and clay were moved to change the flat site into the sculpted landscape you see today. The village was created using hundreds of trees and shrubs, carefully selected for the area. The models, over 100, were individually made by the creator, Colin Sims. They are made from a variety of materials, including stone, concrete, wood, and plastics. The village is popular and well-maintained. You can enjoy the models and the beautiful scenery. Please keep to the paths and do not touch any of the models. Photography is allowed from the pathways only. Dogs are welcome on a short lead. We hope you enjoy your visit to the Model Village.

Every week, British newspapers publish pictures that invade people's privacy. These pictures often include celebrities and other people who are in the public eye. Sometimes, these pictures are very private and can be very hurtful to the people who are pictured. However, very few people call on the services of the Press Complaints Commission (PCC), which is an organization that was set up to deal with issues of this kind. The PCC rarely investigates complaints about pictures that are published in newspapers. This is a scandal. The PCC should also be looking into the outrageous story published recently about a pop star's love life. If the PCC decided to take on this role of 'police officer', there would be several problems. It would be difficult to decide whether or not to launch an inquiry. And if the person involved still refused to do anything, the PCC might still proceed with the investigation.

A lot of advice is available for college leavers heading for their first job. If you are taking a real step on the career ladder and choosing a job to fit in with your ambitions, you should choose your second job very carefully. You should be aiming to stay in it for two to three years. This job will be studied very carefully when you send your letter of application for your next job. It should show evidence of serious career planning. Most important, it should extend you, develop you and give you increasing responsibility.
If you are thinking of travelling, now is the time to pack up and go. You can do temporary work for a while when you return, pick up where you left off and get the second job then. Future potential employers will be relieved to see that you have got it out of your system, and are not likely to go off again.

Confident people often appear to be born with it, but most will tell you that it's a skill they've learned. Nina Hathway asked five people how they did it.
A. Jenny said that working at her daughter's school helped her become more outgoing.
B. Michaela said that to be confident, you have to believe in yourself and be patient.
C. Lisa said that she has to develop the ability to look confident because it's the most vital thing in TV.
D. Barbara said that her confidence comes naturally from really enjoying the work she does.
E. Kim said that to be confident, you have to tell yourself over and over again, 'Nothing is impossible.'

Paul Forster went to a kite-flying festival in Malaysia. He spent a nervous night in the forest. He was given a kite that was traditional and had plenty of other kites. They sat down in the shade of the trees and looked at the festival. The kites flew into the air like rockets. There was a competition with more than 500 men and boys. Each person had entered four different designs. The competition ran for five days. After the festival, Paul went to the southern half of the state and took a wrong turn. He ended up at a river and had to take a boat across. He followed a path into the forest and stayed in a hut. Night was totally black and there was a lot of noise. In the morning, there was a tremendous view of the mountains. It rained and Paul got wet. He slid downhill and wondered how the giant butterflies avoided the enormous drops. He was glad that his car was still there. No one is a stranger for long in Kelantan. Everyone was friendly. Kelantan is best known for its kites, but Paul remembered it more for its human kindness.

What kind of shopper are you? Everyone goes shopping, but there are different types of shoppers. Do you know which kind you are? Abby Edwards asked around and found out that there are different types of shoppers.
There are two main types of shoppers: addicted shoppers and reluctant shoppers. Addicted shoppers love to shop and can't resist spending money. Reluctant shoppers don't enjoy shopping and only go when they have to.
If you are an addicted shopper, you probably spend a lot of money on clothes and feel guilty when you spend too much. If you are a reluctant shopper, you probably don't enjoy shopping and don't spend much time doing it.
